overview: VAT the basics and paying less VAT - tax-free shopping, VAT on energy-saving equipment like solar panels and heat pumps
title: VAT for consumers

table.body:
VAT is a tax you pay on most goods and services. You pay 20% VAT most of the time - but less on essential items.

Rate | % of VAT | What the rate applies to 
- | - | - | -
Standard | 20% | Most goods and services
Reduced rate | 5% | Some goods and services, eg children's car seats and energy-saving materials in the home
Zero rate | 0% | Zero-rated goods and services, eg most food and children's clothes

^ Some things are exempt from VAT - eg postage stamps, financial and property transactions. ^

##How VAT is worked out

When someone charges you VAT they multiply their selling price by the VAT rate to calculate the amount of VAT to charge. 

They then add this to the selling price to give you the price you actually pay - this is called the 'gross' price.

##VAT fraud

If a businesses doesn't have a VAT number they're not registered for VAT and must not charge  VAT. 

^ You can [check a UK VAT number](http://ec.europa.eu/taxation_customs/vies/vieshome.do?selectedLanguage=EN "Check a UK VAT number"){:rel="external"} is valid and [report VAT fraud](/report-vat-fraud "Report VAT fraud") online. ^

*[VAT]: Value Added Tax
table.title: Overview

table.body:
##In shops

If VAT is due on something you buy in a shop it's already included in the price. No tax is added when you pay.

##In adverts, catalogues and price lists

This depends on who they're aimed at:

- if they're for the general public only, they'll show you a price including VAT
- if they're aimed at businesses as well as consumers, they might show the price with VAT and without
- prices aimed at businesses only don't usually include VAT, which is charged on top of the price shown

##On bills and receipts

Sometimes VAT is shown on a separate line. This doesn't mean you're paying extra - it just shows how much tax is included in the price.

Invoices from suppliers like builders, painters and decorators must show a separate amount for VAT and their VAT registration number.

##Tax free shopping

Visitors to the UK or EU residents leaving the EU for 12 months or more can sometimes get [VAT refunds.](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/vat/sectors/consumers/overseas-visitors.htm "VAT refunds for visitors to the UK"){:rel="external"} If the retailer offers tax free shopping they'll give you a customs form and explain how.  

*[VAT]: Value Added Tax
table.title: Where you see VAT

table.body:
You pay a reduced rate of VAT (5%) when certain energy-saving products are installed in your home.

Your supplier will charge you the reduced rate on the installation and any extra work that's part of it. 

^ Not all products qualify for the reduced rate and you can't install them yourself. ^

##Qualifying products

You pay the reduced rate for:

- controls for central heating and hot water systems  
- draught insulation - eg around windows and doors 
- insulation on walls, floors, ceilings, lofts, etc  
- solar panels  
- wind turbines  
- water turbines  
- ground-source heat pumps  
- air-source heat pumps  
- micro combined heat and power units  
- wood-fuelled boilers  

###Central heating systems 

For work funded through energy efficiency grants (eg [Warm Front](/warm-front-scheme "Warm Front Scheme")) the reduced rate of VAT can also apply to the: 

+ installation of [heating appliances](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageLibrary_ShowContent&id=HMCE_CL_000514&propertyType=document#P138_13013 "Reduced VAT on heating appliances"){:rel="external"}
+ installation, repair and maintenance of [heating systems](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageLibrary_ShowContent&id=HMCE_CL_000514&propertyType=document#P123_12112 "Reduced VAT on heating systems"){:rel="external"}

^ The reduced rate is only for the grant-funded part of the work. ^

To qualify, you must be over 60 or getting: 

- Child Tax Credit (but not the family element)
- Council Tax Benefit
- Disability Living Allowance
- a disablement pension
- Housing Benefit
- Job Seeker’s Allowance (income-based)
- Income Support
- War Disablement Pension
- Working Tax Credit

##Energy products that don't qualify

You pay the standard rate of VAT for:  

- heating appliances or systems - unless you get an energy efficiency grant 
- energy efficient boilers  
- secondary or double glazing  
- low emission glass  
- energy efficient fridge freezers  

*[VAT]: Value Added Tax
